name: gestating
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
gestate
gestate verb [I or T]
(BABY)
biology
  specialized (of a female animal) to have a baby developing inside the body or (of a child or young animal) to develop inside a mother's body: Female elephants gestate for a staggering 22 months. healthy foetuses that have gestated at least 20 weeks Those snakes are often females, soaking up the sun to help their metabolism deal with the demand of gestating a litter of young.
More examplesFewer examplesFemales produce more eggs than the number of embryos they are able to gestate to term.A mouse gestates in just 19 days.Do you know a female rat can gestate 21 times a year?

gestate verb [I or T]
(IDEA)
(of an idea, thought, or plan) to develop or be developed over time: The internet had been gestating since the fifties. The subconscious mind needs time to gestate the work. See
gestation
More examplesFewer examplesThis play has been gestating over a period of time.Ideas seem to gestate best in a void.The problems facing the company have been gestating for years. Other deals involving carmakers are now gestating. New lyrics began to gestate in his head.
